DataElement.preferredName: Participant COVID-19 Infection Assessment Future Research Usage Consent Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The consent for usage of participant COVID-19 infection assessment  for future research.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant COVID-19 Infection Assessment Future Research Usage Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.:An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A time that is yet to come._systematic investigation to establish facts._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._Permission to do something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
A time that is yet to come.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.
